plot.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a secret plan by a group of people to do something harmful or illegal
plot.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The court heard how she and her lover hatched a plot (=planned a plot) to kill her husband.
The plot to overthrow the military government was foiled (=prevented from being successful).
a plot to bomb the UN headquarters
plot.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the events that form the main story of a book, film, or play
plot.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The plot was a little confusing.
We discover that Jack isn’t as innocent as he seems, as the plot unfolds (=gradually becomes clearer).
plot.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
plot.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a piece of land that a particular family owns in a cemetery, in which members of the family are buried when they die
plot.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a drawing that shows the plan of a building at ground level
plot.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He was involved in a plot to kidnap the pope.

plot.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government
plot.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The minister was found guilty of plotting the downfall of the government.
the story of a woman who plots revenge

plot.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: We plotted a course across the Pacific.
